data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
Add options to enable/disable IMU diagnostic and identification data publishers (#74)

* src: add node arguments to conditionally publish diagnostics and identification data

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* README: add parameters for diagnostics and identification publishers

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* launch: disable identification and diagnostics publishers

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
Dynamic ADIS Device Detection and Configuration for IMU Node (#73)

* Refactor: initial revision for runtime ADIS detection

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* ImuDiagDataADIS1654X: remove duplicate error fields

- diag_processing_overrun and diag_boot_mem_fail were already
present in the message definition based on the bit position
and the associated description from the ADIS1654 5/7 datasheet
under the status and error flag indications section.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* test: adapted to work after refactoring

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* launch: add parameter substitution arguments for flexibility

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* .github: expand CI to validate builds on different ROS 2 distros

- Humble is the default, but we also validate Jazzy and Rolling

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* refactor: use template to instantiate the diagnostic data publisher

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* .github: use unique names for workflow log artifacts

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* Run format script

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* Run ament_copyright tool

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* Fix ament_cpplint warnings

- Multi-line string warnings were omitted.
- C-style long warnings were also ommitted since
the libiio C API uses this data type.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* README: update build instructions

- The DEVICE_ID env variable is no longer needed
since the imu_device_name is now used at runtime
to specify the device.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* Fix ament_cmake_lint issue

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* LICENSE: revert to original Apache 2.0 license text

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* .github: added linting workflow for ROS2 packages

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* package.xml: enable lint tests

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* test: require explicit enablement of integration tests

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
doc/index.rst: Remove file overriding rosdoc2 template

- Deleting the index.rst file allows rosdoc2 to
  generate an index.html automatically.
- The generated index.html will include API
  documentation, interfaces, and other relevant docs.
- These documents will be placed in the doc folder
  and automatically discovered by rosdoc2.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Ramona Gradinariu
data.message:
Merge pull request #52 from analogdevicesinc/dev/imu_ros2_refactoring

Refactor IMU ROS2 repository

data.author: Ramona Gradinariu
data.message:
Refactor IMU ROS2 repository

This change refactors the current IMU ROS2 repository:
- is compatible with adis16475 Linux Driver
- adds support for new IMU devices from adis1646x and
adis1647x family
- adds user documentation
- rework the overall build infrastructure such that
a specific device has to be selected before a build
(removes the dynamic definition of parameters and
diagnosis flags and adds a static definition based
on the selected device).

Signed-off-by: Ramona Gradinariu <ramona.gradinariu@analog.com>
